estimator.fit(input_fn=tf.estimator.inputs.numpy_input_fn(
x={'_':X_train}, y=y_train, batch_size=args.batch_size, num_epochs=1, shuffle=True))

after fit by GradientBoostedDecisionTreeEstimator , can the GBDT model be saved in JSON format, which can easily loaded by other language such as C++...

body:
@zhedongzheng 
estimator.fit(input_fn=tf.estimator.inputs.numpy_input_fn(
    x={'_':X_train}, y=y_train, batch_size=args.batch_size, num_epochs=1, shuffle=True))

after fit by GradientBoostedDecisionTreeEstimator , can the GBDT model be saved in JSON format, which can easily loaded by other language such as C++...
